intro: Ruellia brunoniana, commonly known as the purple ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of violet to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly velvety texture. Ruellia brunoniana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
